FODEN WANTS SILVA TO STAY

Phil Foden may be regarded as Manchester City's long-term replacement for David Silva but the youngster does not want the "special" Spanish playmaker to leave.

Veteran Silva, 33, announced over the summer that the coming season would be his last for City, taking his service at the club to 10 years.

"It's going to be a shame," said Foden. "I'm not thinking about that too much because I don't want it to happen. He's here now so let's try and be happy.

"He's still a great player, you could see on Wednesday how sharp he is even at the age he is. He's still a special player."

FODEN WANTS SILVA TO STAY

Phil Foden may be regarded as Manchester City's long-term replacement for David Silva but the youngster does not want the "special" Spanish playmaker to leave.

Veteran Silva, 33, announced over the summer that the coming season would be his last for City, taking his service at the club to 10 years.

"It's going to be a shame," said Foden. "I'm not thinking about that too much because I don't want it to happen. He's here now so let's try and be happy.

"He's still a great player, you could see on Wednesday how sharp he is even at the age he is. He's still a special player."

replies.msg:
INTER CHASE ANOTHER FORWARD

Inter Milan are ready to increase their offer to Roma for Edin Dzeko, according to Sky in Italy.
The club are planning to increase their previous bid of €12m to €15m, but it is understood that figure is not expected to meet the demands of Roma, who want €20m.
Roma boss Paulo Fonseca is said to be happy with the former Bosnia-Herzegovina striker and, in the absence of an acceptable offer, is prepared to keep him until his contract expires next year.
Inter have been interested in signing Dzeko along with Manchester United’s Romelu Lukaku, but also remain some distance from meeting the Premier League club’s valuation.

replies.msg: Manchester City have put a price tag of at least £137 million on Leroy Sané amid continuing interest from FC Bayern München. [Telegraph Football]

Manchester City would demand the second biggest transfer fee in football history if Leroy Sane decides he want to joins Bayern Munich.

If Sane want to return to Germany, City would be looking for a fee in the region of £145m.

[@StuBrennanMEN]

Despite initial doubts, Juventus have sat down with Manchester City to listen to the proposal including Danilo for Joao Cancelo.

Juventus value Cancelo at €70m, and Danilo at €25m. Negotiations will continue on Friday, which promises to be ‘another important day’.

[@DiMarzio]
